intro: Ecbolium beyrichii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Ecbolium beyrichii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
